description.narrative:
The Goal of the Capfish/FOSTER project is to improve the socio-economic conditions of the fishing communities and environmental sustainability of the (Western) Tonle Sap Biosphere Reserve (TSBR) through community-centered interventions reaching over 200000 women, men and children in Cambodia. The Capfish/FOSTER Project led by Oxfam and 14 partners has 3 Objectives: 1)Fishing communities in the Tonle Sap have increased access to safe water supply, hygiene and sanitation services2) Vulnerable and poor girls and boys are provided with increased availability and accessibility to education and can successfully transition through school 3) Fishing communities in the Tonle Sap have developed sustainable alternative livelihoods.
The project will the buildon Cambodian Agriculture Cooperative Corporation (CACC)’s public-private-producer partnership (P4) Inclusive business model. A 4P arrangement ensures that smallholder producers are respected partners and not relegated to the receiving end of public-private partnerships (PPPs). Smallholders aretypically not well equipped to negotiate with public and private actors when it comes to recognizing local communities’ tenure rights (to land, water and forests), the role of women and environmental issues. Complexities are in price-setting mechanisms, enforcement of contracts, regulatory issues, payment modalities, ownership and coordination. The 4Ps concept helps to identify and address the use of public funds as an incentive for both the private sector and producers to make better deals in which everyone is genuinely committed to a long-term partnership.
The Project will prototype CACC’s P4 model in the above 4 value chains, including fish processing (Y1), sustainable energy (Y2), rice (Y2) and eco-tourism (Y3) to create sustainable businesses that will secure community livelihoods. CACC will be directly involved in rolling out rice and fish sub-sectors. Together, Okra and CACC will develop a solar energybusiness which will operate community micro grids andsell energy access and services. Oxfam and CACC will replicate it's innovativeblock chain traceability technology for 2 of the target value-chains allowing producers to access information on the supply chain and electronically verify their contract conditions. Oxfam will develop the Blockchain app and CACC will train producers for its use. CACC will conduct follow up assessments to monitor the evolution of capacities under green businesses through the Community Green Business - Hubs (CGB-Hubs).

participating-org.narrative:
Cambodian Agriculture Cooperative Corporation PLC (“CACC”) is a pioneer in the Public-Private-Producer-Partnership (“PPPP”) concept. It is a broad based platform for agriculture products and inputs and aims to: 1. Provide Agriculture Cooperatives (“ACs”) direct access to commercial activities and profits of a private enterprise via share ownership in CACC; 2. Demonstrate leadership in selected UN SDGs in particular those related to alleviating poverty, gender equality and women empowerment, and practices that promote sustainable farming practices. Our goal is to increase farmers’ incomes by as much as 20% (compared to typical farm gate returns); 3. Create innovative agriculture chain solutions (e.g. revolving funds or warehouse receipt systems) which cover diverse, high quality crops; 4. Build close, long term relationships with like-minded parties in the value chain in promoting Cambodian agriculture products.
Why this PPPP? We primarily seek to create stable, long term supply chains that depart from typical ‘farm-gate’ transactions involving middlemen and brokers which usually leave farmers with the lowest prices. In a market downturn, this has devastating economic effects on the farming community. Our aim is to help farmers consistently produce high quality crops that are readily acceptable to the market and help them earn a good return. Registered in late 2017, CACC began operating in earnest in 2H 2018 with trade of organic rice paddy (off-take by Amru Rice) and organic cassava (off-take by leading processor in Thailand and Vietnam). In early 2019 CACC procured organic raw cashew nuts for 3rd party processing and sale to overseas markets. - Goal: • To create and nurture positive and inclusive rural social impact where we are all better as a result of having one another in each other’s lives. The pragmatic application of this philosophy is to ensure that there is a constant flow of respect for time, commitment care for each other’s well-being and support for our mutual success in the form of providing instructions, knowledge and resources necessary to get the coordination work done to the best of everyone’s ability and contribution.
• To establish bond and trust within agricultural cooperative and others actors within the supply chain; and building sustainable and social-agricultural entrepreneurship by implementing agricultural best practice for gap and organic through technical support, capacity building and strengthening internal control system.
•To support sustainable development as embodied in the global SDGs. We will engage smallholder cooperatives in environmentally soundfarming systems that address health and environmental concerns and with meaningful options to diversify crops and step-up to processing raw crops into products through market driven innovative approach
- Vision: • Enabling half a million smallholder farmers engaged with CACC in entrepreneurial and profitable agribusiness. • Becoming leading platform by utilizing latest technology that enables majority of agricultural cooperatives which consist of small holder farmer to be successful Agri-Enterpreneur in producing organicand sustainable crop.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to a sustainable livelihood
